alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Armstrong; Butler; Clarion; Indiana; Jefferson; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 18 at 1:50PM EST until November 18 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Butler County in west central Pennsylvania... Indiana County in west central Pennsylvania... Eastern Allegheny County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Southern Jefferson County in west central Pennsylvania... Westmoreland County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Armstrong County in west central Pennsylvania... Southeastern Clarion County in west central Pennsylvania... * Until 245 PM EST. * At 150 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Punxsutawney to near Leechburg to near White Oak, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 41 and 75. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 78 and 84. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Monroeville, Greensburg, McKeesport, Indiana, Jeannette, Latrobe, Punxsutawney, Vandergrift, Kittanning, and Homer City. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Allegheny; Armstrong; Butler; Clarion; Indiana; Jefferson; Westmoreland
